name: Death Stair
description: Missing the days of split screen multiplayer or wanting to play with actual in-person friends in the same room? Death Stair is a local multiplayer stair climbing game. Play locally with maximum three friends and race to the finish while the fourth, armed to the teeth with an arsenal of unconventional ammo types, does everything to stop...

reviews.review_text: It is fun enough, but very limited, definitely needs more levels. Also, achievements are broken, making zero progress towards any achievement. The price point is fair for a game with online multiplayer, though finding a random to play against can be a challenge

Death Stair is a really great debut for Fun Sponge Games! While it's not without it's issues, I have a strong faith in the dev team to iron out the bugs and leave behind a really well done, polished gem. I've seen game play and have played a little of the game myself, and I'm super excited to play more with my friends at our next game night. I'd definitely recommend this game, especially if you have a few controllers handy!

I first met Death Stair at PAXAus a year(ish) ago and instantly fell in love.  The game has a fairly simple premise by getting to the top of the stairs but how hectic the game can get with 2 other people racing you is pretty fun. It can sometimes feels like you are getting constantly pwned and completely unfair but it still feels fun to have a laugh with other people.  (Note, I received the game by being a Kickstarter backer)
